required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Normative Values Laser Nociceptive Evoked Potentials Depending on the Age
clinical_study.official_title: Normative Values Laser Nociceptive Evoked Potentials Depending on the Age

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: Different neurological damage may alter the pain conduction systems centrally (spinothalamic pathway) or peripherally (small caliber sensory fibers A delta and C). The laser thermal stimulation selectively stimulates the pain pathways and generates nociceptive signals conveyed to the cortex. Registering these cortical responses constitute the technical laser nociceptive evoked potentials. If these tests are routinely used, their interpretation must remain cautious especially in the elderly.

detailed_description.textblock: Different neurological damage may alter the pain conduction systems centrally (spinothalamic pathway) or peripherally (small caliber sensory fibers A delta and C). The laser thermal stimulation selectively stimulates the pain pathways and generates nociceptive signals conveyed to the cortex. Registering these cortical responses constitute the technical laser nociceptive evoked potentials. If these tests are routinely used, their interpretation must remain cautious especially in the elderly. Normal values that are available have been obtained in young subjects. However, various studies have shown that the integration of nociceptive messages depended on age. The aim of this study was to establish normal values of nociceptive evoked potentials for each age group of 18 to 75 years.

primary_outcome.measure: composite outcomes : latencies (ms) and amplitudes (Î¼V) of nociceptive evoked potential

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers are able to participate to this study. They must not have neurological troubles. They will have different stimulations : laser stimulations on lower limbs laser stimulations cervical 20 laser stimulations for each site on the upper limbs laser stimulations on face and neck

intervention.description: 20 laser stimulations for each site : back foot, outer face of the legs, and anterior thigh
15 laser stimulations cervical areas below the ears.

intervention.intervention_name: 20 laser stimulations for each site on the upper limbs
intervention.description: 20 laser stimulations for each site : back of the hands and arms front face

intervention.intervention_name: laser stimulations on face and neck
intervention.description: 15 lasers stimulations for each site : mandibular areas and areas below the ears.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- major
Exclusion Criteria:
- Neurological history
- Neuralgia history (> 3 months)
- Pathology can cause neuropathy (unbalanced thyroid dysfunction, diabetes, kidney failure, chronic hepatitis, HIV ...)
- Dermatological disorder known type of Lucite or photosensitivity
- Medical treatment analgesic, psychotropic or anti-epileptic underway
- Toxic acquired in the last 72 hours (alcohol, cannabis, other toxic ...)
- Pregnant women
- Incapacitate to stand still
- Participation in another biomedical research in the field of pain in the three months prior to inclusion.
